1.name: brainstorm.py
1.title: Brainstorm
1.description: Helps generate initial story ideas, prompts, and creative angles. Appends more ideas to the existing 'ideas.txt' file.
1.help_text: Generates creative writing concepts, characters, and worldbuilding based on input ideas

options.name: --ideas_file
options.description: Path to ideas.txt file containing the concept and/or characters

options.name: --continue
options.description: Continue building on existing ideas in the ideas file

options.name: --save_dir
options.description: Directory to save generated files (default: current directory)

options.name: --lang
options.description: Language for writing (default: English)

options.name: --title
options.description: Suggested title for the writing (optional)

options.name: --genre
options.description: Suggested genre for the writing (optional)

options.name: --num_characters
options.description: Number of main characters to generate (default: 5)

options.name: --worldbuilding_depth
options.description: Depth of worldbuilding detail (1-5, where 5 is most detailed) (default: 3)

options.name: --character_relationships
options.description: Include detailed character relationships

options.name: --concept_only
options.description: Generate only the concept file

options.name: --characters_only
options.description: Generate only the characters file

options.name: --allow_new_characters
options.description: Allow creation of new characters not in the ideas file

2.name: outline_writer.py
2.title: Outline Writer
2.description: Generates a plot outline from your brainstorming file.  You can provide your own outline skeleton and let the AI fill in details.
2.help_text: Generates comprehensive novel outlines with customizable sections, chapters, and detail levels

options.name: --premise_file
options.description: File containing the story premise (required)

options.name: --example_outline
options.description: Example outline for reference

options.name: --concept_file
options.description: File containing detailed concept information (optional)

options.name: --characters_file
options.description: File containing character descriptions (optional)

options.name: --sections
options.description: Number of main parts/sections in the outline (default: 5)

options.name: --chapters
options.description: Number of chapters in the outline (default: 25)

options.name: --lang
options.description: Language for writing (default: English)

options.name: --title
options.description: Suggested title for the novel (optional)

options.name: --genre
options.description: Suggested genre for the novel (optional)

options.name: --detailed
options.description: Generate a more detailed outline with chapter summaries

options.name: --save_dir
options.description: Directory to save generated files (default: current directory)

3.name: world_writer.py
3.title: World Writer
3.description: Extract and develop characters and world elements from a novel outline.  It requires: title, POV, and characters.txt and outline.txt.
3.help_text: Creates comprehensive world-building documents based on story outlines and character files

options.name: --lang
options.description: Language for writing (default: English)

options.name: --title
options.description: Title of story

options.name: --pov
options.description: Point of view

options.name: --characters_file
options.description: Characters

options.name: --outline_file
options.description: Path to the outline file generated by outline_writer.py

options.name: --detailed
options.description: Generate more detailed character and world profiles

options.name: --save_dir
options.description: Directory to save generated files (default: current directory)

4.name: chapter_writer.py
4.title: Chapter Writer
4.description: Uses the outline, chapters list, world document, and any existing manuscript to write rough draft chapters
4.help_text: Uses the outline, chapters list, world document, and any existing manuscript to write rough draft chapters

options.name: --chapters_to_write
options.description:
Path to a file containing a list of chapters to write sequentially, and the format is "9. Chapter Title" per line. 
It may contain one or more chapters. 
It must match the chapter format in the outline. 
See: --request to do just one chapter

options.name: --manuscript
options.description: Path to manuscript file

options.name: --outline
options.description: Path to outline file

options.name: --world
options.description: Path to world file

options.name: --lang
options.description: Language for writing

options.name: --chapter_delay
options.description: Delay in seconds between processing multiple chapters (default: 15 seconds)

options.name: --no_dialogue_emphasis
options.description: Turn off the additional dialogue emphasis (dialogue emphasis is ON by default)

options.name: --no_append
options.description: Disable auto-appending new chapters to manuscript file

options.name: --save_dir
options.description: Directory to save chapter files (default: current directory)

options.name: --backup
options.description: Create backup of manuscript file before appending (default: False)

options.name: --show_token_stats
options.description:
Show tokens stats but do not call API
You just want to double check the settings/numbers.

options.name: --request
options.description: Single chapter format: --request "Chapter 9: Title"   or  "9: Title"   or  "9. Title"

5.name: tokens_words_counter.py
5.title: Counts words and AI tokens
5.description: Counts words and AI tokens for a given text file.
5.help_text: Counts words and AI tokens for a given text file.

options.name: --text_file
options.description: File containing the text to count (required)

6.name: character_analyzer.py
6.title: Character Analyzer
6.description: Analyzes manuscript, outline, and world files to identify and compare character appearances. It extracts a master character list that details which files each character appears in, examines consistency across documents, and highlights discrepancies in names, roles, or relationships. The analysis produces a detailed report with sections and recommendations to improve character coherence. This is needed because AI draft writing has a tendency to add new characters!
6.help_text: Analyze characters across story files using Claude AI.

options.name: --manuscript_file
options.description: File containing the manuscript to analyze (required)

options.name: --outline_file
options.description: File containing the story outline (optional)

options.name: --world_file
options.description: File containing the story world/lore information (optional)

options.name: --save_dir
options.description: Directory to save character analysis reports (default: current directory)

options.name: --skip_thinking
options.description: Skip saving the AI thinking process (smaller output files)

options.name: --analysis_description
options.description: Optional description to include in output filenames

7.name: tense_consistency_checker.py
7.title: Tense Consistency Checker
7.description: Examines the manuscript to evaluate verb tense consistency. It identifies shifts between past and present tense that might confuse readers, focusing on unintentional changes in narrative flow. With customizable analysis levels and configurable chapter markers, it generates a detailed report with examples, explanations, and suggestions for improving consistency.
7.help_text: Analyze manuscript for verb tense consistency using Claude AI.

options.name: --manuscript_file
options.description: File containing the manuscript to analyze (required)

options.name: --analysis_level
options.description:
Level of tense analysis detail:
basic, standard, detailed

options.name: --chapter_markers
options.description: Text that marks the start of chapters (default: 'Chapter')

options.name: --save_dir
options.description: Directory to save tense analysis reports (default: current directory)

options.name: --skip_thinking
options.description: Skip saving the AI thinking process (smaller output files)

options.name: --analysis_description
options.description: Optional description to include in output filenames

9.name: dangling_modifier_checker.py
9.title: Dangling Modifier Checker
9.description:
Manuscript analysis software that detects dangling and misplaced modifiers.
It examines text to pinpoint instances where descriptive phrases don't logically connect to their intended subjects, potentially causing confusion or unintended humor.
With customizable analysis level, sensitivity, and specific modifier types, it generates a detailed report complete with examples, explanations, and revision suggestions to enhance clarity and precision.

10.name: rhythm_analyzer.py
10.title: Rhythm Analyzer
10.description:
Manuscript analysis utility for evaluating the rhythm and flow of prose.
It measures sentence length variations, detects monotonous patterns, and highlights sections where the writing's rhythm doesn't match the intended mood.
 Configurable analysis levels, selectable scene types, and adjustable sensitivity settings allow it to generate a detailed report with examples, explanations, and suggestions for enhancing overall narrative rhythm.

11.name: crowding_leaping_evaluator.py
11.title: Crowding Leaping Evaluator
11.description:
Manuscript pacing evaluator that examines narrative structure for pacing issues.
It identifies overly dense sections (crowding) and abrupt transitions or time jumps (leaping) based on concepts inspired by Ursula K. Le Guin.
 With configurable analysis levels and sensitivity settings, it produces a detailed report—including optional text-based visualizations—that offers feedback and suggestions for improving narrative rhythm and clarity.

13.name: consistency_checker.py
13.title: Consistency Checker
13.description:
Manuscript consistency checker utility that compares a manuscript against a world document (and optionally an outline).
It supports various consistency checks: world, internal, development, and unresolved.
Configurable options enable targeted analysis of character, setting, timeline, and thematic consistency, producing detailed reports with examples and recommendations for resolving discrepancies.

15.name: foreshadowing_tracker.py
15.title: Foreshadowing Tracker
15.description:
Manuscript analysis utility for identifying foreshadowing elements and tracking their payoffs.
 It pinpoints explicit clues, subtle hints, and Chekhov's Gun elements to evaluate how well narrative setups are resolved.
 With customizable options to select foreshadowing types and organization modes (chronological or by type), it generates detailed reports featuring examples, assessments, and recommendations for fulfilling narrative promises.

16.name: plot_thread_tracker.py
16.title: Plot Thread Tracker
16.description:
Manuscript analysis utility for identifying and tracking distinct plot threads—revealing how they interconnect, converge, and diverge throughout the narrative.
 It uses text-based representations (with optional ASCII art visualization) and supports configurable analysis depth (basic, detailed, or comprehensive) to produce detailed reports with progression maps, thread connections, and narrative assessments, including manuscript excerpts and recommendations for strengthening the plot architecture.
